text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Matanzas |other_name = San Carlos y San Severino de Matanzas |native_name = |nickname = La Atenas de Cuba Venice of Cuba City of Bridges |settlement_type = Municipality |motto = |image_skyline = Cuba - Matanzas - Matanzas from Ermita de Monserrate church.jpg |image_caption = The city and bay of Matanzas |image_flag = |flag_size = |image_seal = |seal_size = |image_shield = |shield_size = 120x90px |city_logo = |citylogo_size = |image_map = Matanzas (Cuban municipal map).png |map_caption = Matanzas municipality (red) within Matanzas Province (yellow) and Cuba |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Cuba |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = Matanzas |subdivision_type2 = |subdivision_name2 = |subdivision_type3 = |subdivision_name3 = |subdivision_type4 = |subdivision_name4 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |leader_title2 = |leader_name2 = |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |leader_title4 = |leader_name4 = |established_title = Settled |established_date = 1572 |established_title2 = Founded |established_date2 = 1693 |established_title3 = Established |established_date3 = 1695 |area_magnitude = |unit_pref = |area_total_km2 = 317 |area_land_km2 = |area_water_km2 = |area_land_sq_mi = |area_blank1_title = |area_blank1_km2 = |population_as_of = 2012 |population_note = |population_total = 145246 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_urban = |population_density_urban_km2 = |population_blank1_title = |population_blank1 = |population_demonym = Matancero/a |timezone = EST |utc_offset = -5 |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |coordinates = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 20 |postal_code_type = Postal code |postal_code = 40100 |area_code = +53 52 |blank_name = |blank_info = |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = |footnotes = }} Matanzas (Cuban ) is the capital of the Cuban province of Matanzas. It is located on the northern shore of the island of Cuba, on the Bay of Matanzas (Spanish Bahia de Matanzas). It is east of the capital Havana and west of the resort town of Varadero. Matanzas is called the City of Bridges, for the seventeen bridges that cross the three rivers.Ciudad de Matanzas - A website with much information in Spanish about the city of Matanzas, from its foundation to the present day ==References== Category:Cities in Cuba Category:Provincial capitals in Cuba
title: Matanzas
